comments.html: I believe it's a way to entice customers to migrate away from DWDM platforms currently running MEF style EVP-LAN instance which preserves VLAN headers but doesn't isolate broadcast domain per VLAN. Come to our packet based platform and we can give you the same thing plus proper VLAN isolation.
comments.name: Jeff Behrns

comments.html: Number of MAC-VRF EVPN instances is limited (platform/os limitations). Serving multiple BDs/VLANs by one MAC-VRF could be a solution.
